messages.message: yep and here's melissa's input on the copy https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05NKL85Y2G/p1747930524833919, so returning all the docs/fields where there are issues

one additional question, currently, in various places in the code we allow for "ERROR" to be a valid value for a table, as this is the default value for when a table can't be found or there's some extraction/clean line error. is this still okay, or should the user be prompted to change this an empty table?

@Kaustubh (KD) can you provide input on this?
• as discussed above, if the user sets a table field to an invalid value in human review, we will block running an accuracy test and show an error toast
• should we do the same if the creation of the ground truth set resulted in an invalid value for a table?
    ◦ ie when the app was run to create a gt set, there was some table extraction error or cleaning error
my preference is yes we should be consistent
• no matter how the invalid value for the table field was introduced (during gt set creation or Human Review), we should block running an accuracy test
Yeah so to echo points made, we should do the same during ground truth data set creation --> we should throw an error when a user tries to save an invalid value

Yep sounds good, just wanted to check that case since we basically have an equivalence between error and no table, which wouldn’t match an empty table in an accuracy test, which the user would now have to set the field value to if the initial value is ERROR. But that makes sense, and smth data types will be good for
